meanings.definition: The blood flowing through the circulatory system of a person or animal.
meanings.sent1: The doctor explained how the bloodstream carries oxygen to all parts of the body.
meanings.sent2: The bloodstream is essential for transporting nutrients and removing waste from our cells.
meanings.sent3: The bloodstream must be a busy highway with all those red blood cells zooming around.
meanings.sent4: Her love for music flows through her bloodstream, inspiring her every day.
meanings.sent5: The image of the bloodstream as a river of life is both beautiful and powerful.

meanings.definition: The flow of blood through the veins and arteries of a living body.
meanings.sent1: A healthy diet can help maintain a strong and efficient bloodstream.
meanings.sent2: Exercise is important for keeping the bloodstream clear and free from blockages.
meanings.sent3: The bloodstream in our bodies works tirelessly, like a dedicated team of workers.
meanings.sent4: His passion for adventure runs through his bloodstream, driving him to explore new places.
meanings.sent5: The doctor's words painted a vivid picture of the bloodstream as a bustling highway of life.
